pr_title: fix(iot-dev): Fix issue where MQTT didn't url encode application properties correctly

timeline.message:
fix(iot-dev): Fix issue where MQTT didn't url encode application properties correctly

URLEncoder.Encode fails to encode the character '+', so I've added a manual replace step for this character.

Also removing all character validation for application property keys and values now that this MQTT bug is fixed. There is no longer a device-side reason to validate these values as all protocols are encoding them correctly now such that the protocol doesn't throw an exception. Iot Hub will be the validator, not the client

timeline.bodyText: whoa, who added hindi in here!
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to validate even this?
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: Maybe not, but that kind of change is a bit out of scope for the customer issue I'm working to solve. Maybe if a customer complains later, we can re-evaluate
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: What's the limitation with URLEncoder being unable to encode +?
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: "Note that Java’s URLEncoder class encodes space character(" ") into a + sign. This is contrary to other languages like Javascript that encode space character into %20."
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: Just updated my explanation above, the problem is actually that URLEncoder.Encode(...) encodes spaces as '+' which is unusual for url encoding. For MQTT in particular, you can't have '+' characters in the topic string, but you can have '%20'
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: So are we encoding space or "+"?
replies.author: abhipsaMisra
timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: C# does this correctly when using UrlPathEncode: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.web.httputility.urlencode?view=netcore-3.1
replies.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText:
yes, this is what I was looking for: We are fixing how ' ' gets encoded by replacing the incorrect '+' with the correct '%20'
The initial wording of the PR confused me.
I would suggest adding this as a comment where the manual replace is done.
replies.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: Sure thing, I can add some comments to clarify this .replaceAll call
